bridgeERC20(uint8,uint256,bytes,uint8).details: The provided tokenID and destinationChainID must be supported. The caller must have approved this contract to transfer the given token.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be bridged.
params.destinationChainID: The ID of the destination chain.
params.recipientAddress: The address on the Sui chain where the tokens will be sent.
params.tokenID: The ID of the token to be bridged.

bridgeERC20V2(uint8,uint256,bytes,uint8).details: The provided tokenID and destinationChainID must be supported. The caller must have approved this contract to transfer the given token.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be bridged.
params.destinationChainID: The ID of the destination chain.
params.recipientAddress: The address on the Sui chain where the tokens will be sent.
params.tokenID: The ID of the token to be bridged.

bridgeETH(bytes,uint8).details: The provided destinationChainID must be supported.

params.destinationChainID: The ID of the destination chain.
params.recipientAddress: The address on the destination chain where Eth will be sent.

bridgeETHV2(bytes,uint8).details: The provided destinationChainID must be supported.

params.destinationChainID: The ID of the destination chain.
params.recipientAddress: The address on the destination chain where Eth will be sent.

executeEmergencyOpWithSignatures(bytes[].details: If the given operation is to freeze and the bridge is already frozen, the operation will revert.

params.message: The BridgeUtils containing the details of the operation.
params.signatures: The array of signatures to verify.

initialize(address,address,address).details: this function should be called directly after deployment (see OpenZeppelin upgradeable standards).

params._committee: The address of the committee contract.
params._limiter: The address of the bridge limiter contract.
params._vault: The address of the bridge vault contract.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

transferBridgedTokensWithSignatures(byte.details: `message.chainID` represents the sending chain ID. Receiving chain ID needs to match this bridge's chain ID (this chain).

params.message: The BridgeUtils containing the transfer details.

transferBridgedTokensWithSignaturesV2(by.details: `message.chainID` represents the sending chain ID. Receiving chain ID needs to match this bridge's chain ID (this chain).

params.message: The BridgeUtils containing the transfer details.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeWithSignatures(bytes[],(uint8,uin.details: The function will revert if the provided signatures or message is invalid.

params.signatures: The array of signatures to be verified.

bridgeERC20(uint8,uint256,bytes,uint8).notice: Enables the caller to deposit supported tokens to be bridged to a given destination chain.

bridgeERC20V2(uint8,uint256,bytes,uint8).notice: Enables the caller to deposit supported tokens to be bridged to a given destination chain.

bridgeETH(bytes,uint8).notice: Enables the caller to deposit Eth to be bridged to a given destination chain.

bridgeETHV2(bytes,uint8).notice: Enables the caller to deposit Eth to be bridged to a given destination chain.

executeEmergencyOpWithSignatures(bytes[].notice: Executes an emergency operation with the provided signatures and message.

initialize(address,address,address).notice: Initializes the SuiBridge contract with the provided parameters.

transferBridgedTokensWithSignatures(byte.notice: Allows the caller to provide signatures that enable the transfer of tokens to the recipient address indicated within the message payload.

transferBridgedTokensWithSignaturesV2(by.notice: Allows the caller to provide signatures that enable the transfer of tokens to the recipient address indicated within the message payload.

upgradeWithSignatures(bytes[],(uint8,uin.notice: Enables the upgrade of the inheriting contract by verifying the provided signatures.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct BridgeUtilsV2.TokenTransferPayloadV2 memory)
literal_string "SuiBridge: Failed to transfer ETH to vault"

arguments.value: SuiBridge: Failed to transfer ETH to vault

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "SuiBridge: Failed to transfer ETH to vault"
